Module it.polimi.ingsw
Package it.polimi.ingsw.model

Class Game

java.lang.Object
it.polimi.ingsw.model.Game
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable
Direct Known Subclasses:
GameExpertMode
public class Game extends Object implements Serializable
This class is the core of the game model, as it holds all the values that describe its status. Each game is controlled by a GameController, which triggers all the status changes (note that this class acts as some sort of "interface" between the "physical" elements of the game and the controller). This class contains all the necessary values to play a Normal mode match. For Expert mode matches, see the GameExpertMode model and the related GameControllerExpertMode.
See Also:

    • refillClouds

      public void refillClouds() throws EmptyBagException
      Calls the GameBoard method which refills the cloud with the bag students, once each of them is empty.
      Throws:
      EmptyBagException - if no student is present in the students' bag.

    • playerMovesStudent

      public void playerMovesStudent(String color, int islandID) throws IslandNotFoundException, StudentNotFoundException
      Calls the Player method which takes a student from their hall and moves it onto the specified island.
      Parameters:
      color - the color of the student to move.
      islandID - the ID of the island to move the student to.
      Throws:
      IslandNotFoundException - if the provided ID does not correspond to any of the existing islands.
      StudentNotFoundException - if the provided color does not match to any of the player's hall students' colors.

    • playerMovesStudent

      public void playerMovesStudent(String color) throws FullTableException, StudentNotFoundException, NonExistentColorException
      Calls the Player method which takes a student from their hall and moves it to the correct table.
      Parameters:
      color - the color of the student to move.
      Throws:
      FullTableException - if the table of the provided color is full.
      StudentNotFoundException - if the provided color does not match to any of the player's hall students' colors.
      NonExistentColorException - if the player somehow manages to provide a non-existent color as a parameter.

    • profCheck

      public void profCheck() throws NonExistentColorException
      Makes overriding possible in GameExpertMode. If the game is played in Normal mode, calls the profCheckAlgorithm method.
      Throws:
      NonExistentColorException - if the method somehow tries to access to tables of non-existing colors (it should never happen, so it is safely ignorable).

    • profCheckAlgorithm

      public static void profCheckAlgorithm(List<Player> players) throws NonExistentColorException
      Reassigns the professors if the necessary conditions are reached.
      Parameters:
      players - the list of the playing players whose tables need to be checked.
      Throws:
      NonExistentColorException - if the method somehow tries to access to tables of non-existing colors (it should never happen, so it is safely ignorable).

    • moveMotherNature

      public void moveMotherNature(int steps) throws InvalidNumberOfStepsException
      Allows Mother Nature to move of the given steps, if possible.
      Parameters:
      steps - the desired number of steps.
      Throws:
      InvalidNumberOfStepsException - if the provided number of steps violates the game's rules.

    • islandConquerCheck

      public void islandConquerCheck(int islandID) throws IslandNotFoundException
      Triggers the chain of methods which decides whether the island where Mother Nature is will be conquered by the current player.
      Parameters:
      islandID - the ID of the island to check.
      Throws:
      IslandNotFoundException - if the provided ID does not correspond to any of the existing islands.

    • takeStudentsFromCloud

      public void takeStudentsFromCloud(int cloudID) throws EmptyCloudException
      Triggers the chain of methods that moves all the students from the chosen cloud into the hall of the current player, if possible.
      Parameters:
      cloudID - the ID of the chosen cloud.
      Throws:
      EmptyCloudException - if the chosen cloud is empty (which means it has already been chosen on the same round).

    • startGame

      public void startGame()
      Fills the players' halls with the right amount of students and shuffles the players' order at the beginning of the match, in order to start the game properly.
